From dlely at juno.com  Wed Nov 22 02:08:01 2006
From: dlely at juno.com (David L. Ely)
Date: Tue, 21 Nov 2006 23:08:01 -0800
Subject: FL: Pasadena Doo Dah Parade Thanks
Message-ID: <20061121.231705.-406315.1.dlely@juno.com>

To All Doo Dah Paraders:

I wanted to thank everyone so much who came out this past Sunday to
either participate in or watch the 30th Occational Pasadena Doo Dah
Parade!  I think it had to be one of the hottest ones on record, but
everyone did wonderfully, and the spectators lining the streets seemed
very excited to see us!

Our Escorts (who carried our banner and kept us hydrated):
Brown Wolf
Firewolf (new this year)
Hoof Hearted
Tiger Tabbie
Trigger Happy Squirrel

Fursuiting Participants (who braved flying marshmallows and tortillas):
Donkey as Lambert (new this year)
Hunterkitty (new in suit this year)
Jazman Concolor as King Lion (new this year)
Sahara as Joust (in his new suit)
Scruff E. Coyote (on skateboard)
Single Speed Chetah (from back east)
Tommi Tigre as Rajah (new this year)
WereWoof (appearing as such for the last time)
Viperman as PT Skunk (new this year)

Thanks again to all and hope to see everyone plus even more next year!

David L. Ely - AKA: Scruff E. Coyote - dlely at juno.com
"How many hearts with warm blood in them are beating
under the cover of the woods . . . .   A multitude of
animal people, intimately related to us . . . are busy
about their own affairs as we are about ours." - John Muir

From iluvferrets53187 at aol.com  Wed Nov 29 00:34:15 2006
From: iluvferrets53187 at aol.com (iluvferrets53187 at aol.com)
Date: Wed, 29 Nov 2006 00:34:15 -0500
Subject: FL:  Get your fuzzy-slippers on!
Message-ID: <8C8E18F243D9F4E-504-775B@MBLK-M42.sysops.aol.com>

  Its that magical time of year when the stores start carrying those animal-feet fuzzy slippers! 
 
 When the Walmart manager took us Wii-campers to the layaway aclove to purchase our video game glee, I noticed some dinosaur-looking fuzzy slippers/feet. They come in three colours: light pink, brown, and black. They have three toes and claws. Also, Hot Topic is carrying black cat slippers with four toes and little claws, and these even have a pink pawpad design on the bottoms! They were 15.99, and I think the Wal-mart ones are around 10. 
 
 So stock up while you can! They're great "cheat-feet" for fursuits. 
 
 ~Link Wolf (previously known as Jackie Randa)

   Its that magical time of year when the stores start carrying those animal-feet fuzzy slippers! 

  When the Walmart manager took us Wii-campers to the layaway aclove to purchase our video game glee, I noticed some dinosaur-looking fuzzy slippers/feet. They come in three colours: light pink, brown, and black. They have three toes and claws. Also, Hot Topic is carrying black cat slippers with four toes and little claws, and these even have a pink pawpad design on the bottoms! They were 15.99, and I think the Wal-mart ones are around 10. 

  So stock up while you can! They're great "cheat-feet" for fursuits.

From francisco-sender-6f5fe9 at vulpes.net  Thu Nov 30 11:40:18 2006
From: francisco-sender-6f5fe9 at vulpes.net (Francisco Azinsan)
Date: Thu, 30 Nov 2006 11:40:18 -0500
Subject: FL: FC2007: Fur Your Eyes Only - November Mission Briefings
Message-ID: <20061130164018.GA9832@urocyon.critter.net>

Dear frith, my covers blown as wide as my ears are long and theres no way
I am gonna get out of this one. I am sending this communique via the
secret carrot in the Farmers Market. Hopefully HQ will get it and get it
out to the agents. Oh man..here they come....

In this issue:1.  Hotels - both of them - sold out
2.  Pre-Registration Cutoff Date Reminder
3.  Hotel reservation Cutoff Date Reminder
4.  Artshow Sold out
5.  Preliminary Schedule Published
6.  Go-fur Hunt!
7.  Extra AV Staff needed
8.  Special Musical Guest
9.  Fursuit Badge Procedure
10. Next Public Meeting



FC2007 November Mission Briefing:

1.  Hotels - both of them - sold out

The San Jose Doubletree is completely sold out at this point. Sadly, our
overflow hotel is now also sold out. We are in communication with the
Holiday Inn to see if an expansion is possible, but if not please see our
page on other hotels that are nearby. 

<http://www.furtherconfusion.org/fc2007/other_hotels.php> 


2.  Pre-Registration Cutoff Date Reminder

Just a reminder that with the holidays fast approaching, the deadline for
preregistration cutoff is December 30. Standing in lines makes any agent
open target ya know. Avoid that fate and save $5 at the same time!


3.  Hotel reservation Cutoff Date Reminder

December 30 is also the cutoff for hotel reservations. Not that there are
likely to be any left at the convention rate by then...but you never know,
there may be some agents who just can't make it. Pesky henchman and all
that sort of thing.


4.  Artshow Sold out

The Artshow for FC2007 is sold out. We expect that applications currently
in the mail will fill in the remaining panels. While we're excited that
our show has filled in record time, we're also sad that some artists will
miss out. We'll do our best to have as many of you in the show as
possible.

If you'd like to be put on a waiting list, please send in your application
as usual and we'll inform you if you have guaranteed space, or if you're
on the waiting list. We won't bank any cheques until we can guarantee you
space. It is usual that some artists cancel, or reduce their panel numbers
leading up to the con, so don't give up hope just yet. Also, it's common
that unused panels become available at show, so even if we can't guarantee
you panels, you may want to plan to bring along a half or full panel's
worth of artwork "just in case". Tell us if you're doing this, so we can
keep you informed, and prepare our databases before the show. 


5.  Preliminary Schedule Published

A preliminary version of the schedule for Further Confusion 2007 is now
online at our WWW site, available at:

<http://www.furtherconfusion.org/fc2007/schedulebyday.php>

This schedule is connected directly into our scheduling system, so is
subject to change as we work on putting the year's convention together.
But things are getting pretty well locked down. So, take a peek, see what
we have to offer now, and check back as we give you even more reason to
make it out to San Jose, in January.


6.  Go-fur Hunt!

Even with all of our staff, we need spur of the moment help too. New to
the whole con thing? Wanna see how it works behind the scenes? Can't
afford the membership? Or just wanna help out? Gofuring is for you then.
Head up to the Gofur Den! 20 hours of your time from Thursday til Monday
and you get access to gofur crash, food, and the option of compensation or
a free membership to FC 2008!


7.  Extra AV Staff needed

AV Tech crew is accepting applications for at-convention staff for all
positions at all events.  No experience necessary.   Staff Registration
and a minimum of 2 shifts are requested.   Shifts available for all major
events (FNL, Masquerade, etc..) as well as time slot based shifts for
FCTV, and  regular technical operations.  E-mail av at furtherconfusion.org
if interested.


8.  Special Musical Guest

FC2007 is pleased to announce special music guests, Sub-level 03.  The air
will be buzzing with fresh energy and sounds as Sub-level 03 takes the
stage before you very ears.  Get your paws moving to the groove of SL3 in
fursuit or out and come party with SL3 on their Fallout tour show at
FC2007. 

<http://www.sublevel3.us/>


9.  Fursuit Badge Procedure

If you have a fursuit, are pre-registered, and need a fursuit badge,
here's what to do. Before January 1, 2007, send a picture of your fursuit
to fursuit-badges at furtherconfusion.org and include the following
information in the email:

- Your real name
- The fursuit name
- Your registration confirmation number

The file can be any standard picture format (JPEG, PNG, TIFF, etc.) at 300
DPI with a usable area of 450 by 600 pixels.

The first fursuit badge is free (though a donation to the convention would
be appreciated), while subsequent badges are $5 each.

Photographs for fursuit badges will also be taken at the convention.
Please see the times that will be posted at the Registration Desk for the
hours this will be offered.


10. Next Public Meeting

Our next staff meeting will be December 16th starting at noon in the San
Jose Doubletree. Parking is free - just tell the parking attendant that
you're with Further Confusion when you arrive, and then get a sticker for
your parking slip in the meeting.


Technology gets better everyday. That's fine. But most of the time all you
need is a stick of gum, a pocket knife and a smile. 
-- 
Further Confusion
info at furtherconfusion.org
http://www.furtherconfusion.org/

From donkeyears at gmail.com  Fri Dec  1 02:13:07 2006
From: donkeyears at gmail.com (Donkey)
Date: Thu, 30 Nov 2006 23:13:07 -0800
Subject: FL: Question about when one is making a fursuit.
Message-ID: <d23d76ca0611302313q251d118ag222d4dc7e3b722c3@mail.gmail.com>

I was working on making a new fursuit for my self. Well my BF asked if
others wear an old fursuit when they are making a new fursuit as I do. With
out giving it any thought at all I said. "Of course others do." As the days
passed. I started to think about just that question. Do others wear fursuits
or other odd clothing when making a fursuit?

So I'm going to put that same question out to all of you. Do you wear an old
fursuit or anything else odd when your making a new fursuit?

I might wear any of or all of monster feet or hooves (The hooves would be on
my feet. I cant work with my hand hooves on =b), bodysuit and a fursuit head
when I'm making a new fursuit.

Am I weird even for furries?

His Most Royal Highass, Donkey
-------------- next part --------------
An HTML attachment was scrubbed...
URL: http://lists.fursuit.org/mailman/private/fursuit-list/attachments/20061130/ab6c0496/attachment.htm 

From superbh at pureandfur.freeserve.co.uk  Fri Dec  1 10:01:53 2006
From: superbh at pureandfur.freeserve.co.uk (Super BH)
Date: Fri, 1 Dec 2006 15:01:53 -0000
Subject: FL: Question about when one is making a fursuit.
References: <d23d76ca0611302313q251d118ag222d4dc7e3b722c3@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <002001c71559$a2e46c20$0b00000a@NoobSaibot>

If I'm correct in thinking what you mean, it must be REALLY tricky to sew something when you're inside a bulky, cumbersome costume, with less than 100% vision. Also, wearing big ass paws would be pretty risky when sewing. They could get mangled in the machine easily, and hand sewing would be torture trying to hold a TINY needle with slippery fur.

Hedgie
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Donkey

  His Most Royal Highass, Donkey

From fursuit at jovino.com  Fri Dec  1 15:04:56 2006
From: fursuit at jovino.com (=?ISO-8859-1?Q?jovino_=A0?=)
Date: Fri, 1 Dec 2006 12:04:56 -0800
Subject: FL: Question about when one is making a fursuit.
In-Reply-To: <d23d76ca0612011047w67393c1dv3023b523ccb4c0f6@mail.gmail.com>
References: <d23d76ca0611302313q251d118ag222d4dc7e3b722c3@mail.gmail.com>
	<002001c71559$a2e46c20$0b00000a@NoobSaibot>
	<d23d76ca0612011047w67393c1dv3023b523ccb4c0f6@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <2CFD017E-70DB-4090-AAF1-56B9D335AD5C@jovino.com>

Y'alls are crazy, and making me crack up here!!

Sometimes I'll wear paw-shaped slippers on my feet, but I need to be  
able to move freely when I sew. Plus it's really hot under the lights  
in my sewing studio so anything beyond a t-shirt quickly becomes too  
much to work in.

Occasionally I'll take some scraps or oops pieces and turn them into  
a hat or something and wear that while continuing my project. I have  
one that started out being a onsie footie, and I hemmed it and turned  
it into a Schiaparelli -esque hat. I even wore it out to dinner later  
that evening. HA!

My girlfriend typically wears ears and tails all the time, so she's  
kinda suited-up when we are working together.


This is a great thread. I want to hear from more people! I think I am  
going to cross-post this to the fursuit LJ because it's just too  
funny not to!


( )_( )
(o , o)
(").(")

jovino

From saebianfrobosh at gmail.com  Fri Dec  1 15:37:02 2006
From: saebianfrobosh at gmail.com (Saebian Frobosh)
Date: Fri, 1 Dec 2006 13:37:02 -0700
Subject: FL: Making a fursuit head
In-Reply-To: <BAY115-F9133FB6DF20DBD97F2F73A9DA0@phx.gbl>
References: <20061201182453.20835.qmail@web55907.mail.re3.yahoo.com>
	<BAY115-F9133FB6DF20DBD97F2F73A9DA0@phx.gbl>
Message-ID: <b5d7e70b0612011237m5c7592ddudbd5c3f093279e0c@mail.gmail.com>

Perhaps a product called "Rigid Wrap" could help  you.  Its like a very thin
bandage with casting powder on it..  you smear vasoline on your face dip
these strips in watere and place them upon your head. I suggest having a
helper and dont cover up your nose.

From rsg0910 at iglou.com  Fri Dec  1 22:06:48 2006
From: rsg0910 at iglou.com (Robert Goodwin)
Date: Fri, 1 Dec 2006 22:06:48 -0500 (EST)
Subject: FL: Question about when one is making a fursuit.
In-Reply-To: <no.id> from "Springmoon" at Dec 01, 2006 09:34:34 PM
Message-ID: <E1GqLDE-0007eg-NJ@shell1.iglou.com>

> I wear my feetpaws and my tail and my collar and my ears, then run
> around the house screaming, "EGADS. FURSUIT." and dripping little bits
> of foam and glue everywhere.

heh... Reminds me of the time when I was doing WerGoyle, I totally trashed 
two rooms just doing it. I had to clean them up just to walk around easily 
and go to sleep that night, however late it was. However, cleaning off the 
sticky spray glue in places was another story.

When I do my creations, I just wear regular clothing. Sometimes regular 
shorts when I'm trying on a bodysuit to check its appearance and fit. I 
prefer handsewing even though I got an all-metal machine here.

Anyone know those warm "bodysack" things made with fleece using either 
zippers or snaps? Anyone ever try making something like that with fur, 
making a "padded suit" inside, but making it look like a furry sleeved 
sleeping bag? We're talking warm, even when you turn off the furnace for 
the night or it's failed.

Hmm... Another fursuit idea there... Full body padded thing that only your 
helper can get you out of. I think we talked about this awhile ago on 
another thread, "24 hour suit technology," if I remember right.

-boogi-

(going through crunch time at the local university...)

-- 
Homepage: http://www.furnation.com/boogi/
  AIM: rg1004 / boogikat007   ICQ: 103051846
       Y!M: boogikat         MSNM: boogikat007

Sez who that a deaf person can't have fun on the net? No ears required!

From monkaya_blue_wolf at yahoo.com  Sat Dec  2 02:49:58 2006
From: monkaya_blue_wolf at yahoo.com (Monkaya)
Date: Fri, 1 Dec 2006 23:49:58 -0800 (PST)
Subject: FL: Making a fursuit head
In-Reply-To: <BAY115-F3116A19B7E2965383A6CF0A9DA0@phx.gbl>
Message-ID: <190229.64563.qm@web55906.mail.re3.yahoo.com>

OOC:
	MONKAYA:  Hel-gro, Fursuit.Org!
	-
	Head Consruction:
	^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
	Some heads begin as a big square block of
(styrofoam?) Which is carefully carved (carve hole for
thy head first!}

http://www.marcwolf.org/  shows a possible
construction technique
	____

	-- SAEBIAN ... a product called "Rigid Wrap"

	Maybe construct a frame of character head to put the
Rigid Wrap on instead,using:
	- yarn needle point mesh, 
	- cardboard strips glued like a geodesic dome, 
	- or gallon milk jug panels pinned together,
	- a paper bag
	____

	-- SHANE:  ... rather not ... make me feel
claustraphobic

	I built my wolf head piece by piece with cardstock
cardboard sheets.  [construction photos at 'gallery'
link below.  srcoll menu down to [fursuit]].
    ____________________________	
    |
    | 	 |\,/|
    |	< * * > 
    |	  \_/

    |	friendly neighborhood werewolf.
    |
    |	'Monkaya's Gallery'
    |
http://www.geocities.com/monkayawerewolf/Wolf_Main_Frame.htm

From rsg0910 at iglou.com  Sun Dec  3 01:00:23 2006
From: rsg0910 at iglou.com (Robert Goodwin)
Date: Sun, 3 Dec 2006 01:00:23 -0500 (EST)
Subject: FL: Making a fursuit head
In-Reply-To: <no.id> from "shane ramos" at Dec 01, 2006 08:47:08 PM
Message-ID: <E1GqkOm-0000rq-8N@shell1.iglou.com>

> suggesting that i should make some sorta cast of my face? I'd rather not 
> since thinking of doing it with make me feel claustraphobic

You can have a full head and shoulders lifecast done of yourself. Either 
that or a casting without the face. This will allow you to make the head 
easily fit you. If you read through the fursuit FAQ/wiki, it'll tell you 
in detail how it's done. I wouldn't suggest doing it to yourself. Best to 
have someone do it to you.

However, those styrofoam heads are smaller than normal heads. A cheap 
method would be to measure your own head, foam out the styrofoam head to 
your head's measurement in places, then cover with duct tape or something 
like that.

If you do have claustrophobia, I wrote something in the FAQ/wiki about 
just this, having done it to my brother who does have claustrophobia.

I would not suggest using Rigid Wrap at all. It takes too long to dry. 
Medical plaster bandages from a medical supply house will do better.

-boogi-

-- 
Homepage: http://www.furnation.com/boogi/
  AIM: rg1004 / boogikat007   ICQ: 103051846
       Y!M: boogikat         MSNM: boogikat007

Sez who that a deaf person can't have fun on the net? No ears required!

From grey_llama at yahoo.com  Mon Dec  4 12:44:17 2006
From: grey_llama at yahoo.com (Sean Rook)
Date: Mon, 4 Dec 2006 09:44:17 -0800 (PST)
Subject: FL: Kids Expo: April 2007
Message-ID: <20061204174418.4426.qmail@web30405.mail.mud.yahoo.com>

Hey guys, Grizz asked me to look into putting together
the group for Kids Expo next year.  Unfortunately it's
looking like he won't be able to attend so if
necessary I'll try and be the point person for this
event.  

The Kids Expo parade will take place in Poughkeepsie
on Sunday April 15th.  I don't have a time yet but if
it is similar to last year then it will take place
sometime late morning/early afternoon.  If anyone is
interested in joining please let me know.  I am going
to set up a post on the lj community fursuit_gigs
later today and will hopefully have more information
by the end of the week.

For anyone that wasn't able to attend last year, the
event was an absolute blast.  Should be similar to
last year, starts off as a parade around Poughkeepsie
(I believe it was about a mile, but I will confirm
this) and then moves towards the information booths
inside the rec center - which is mostly geared towards
a younger audience.  We interact with the kids
wandering around, it will be a bit crowded, some of us
were also able to use the indoor ice skating rink.

More info can be found on my old lj post about the
event:
http://freakylynx.livejournal.com/283060.html

Also, the co-sponsor for the event was very pleased
with our participation, below is a follow-up email he
recently mailed to Grizz.

"Just wanted to let you know that we are already
planning Kids Expo '07!!!  The dates are April 14 -
15, with the parade taking place on Sunday the 15th.
I am excited about the upcoming Expo, and am working
hard to smooth out some of the bumps I encountered
last year.
The Fursuiters were a HUGE attraction last year, and I
truly hope that you can be a part of Kids Expo '07
this coming April.  Please let me know if you think
you and your animals can make it again."


Hope to hear from everyone soon ^.^
-Lynx

From monkaya_blue_wolf at yahoo.com  Mon Dec  4 17:12:24 2006
From: monkaya_blue_wolf at yahoo.com (Monkaya)
Date: Mon, 4 Dec 2006 14:12:24 -0800 (PST)
Subject: FL: Making a fursuit head
In-Reply-To: <BAY115-DAV181449749E265EE2ADA3A7A9D80@phx.gbl>
Message-ID: <965881.59159.qm@web55906.mail.re3.yahoo.com>


	OOC:
	MONKAYA:  Hel-gro,  Shane!
	-
	-- SHANE:  ... that?s what I'm trying to talk about

	Are ye:

	1 - building head -directly onto- baraclva?

	2 - making a positive negative mold for a rubber mask
foundation (wich likely -destroys- baraclava)?
	____

	-- ROBERT:  ... foam out the styrofoam head to your
head's measurement in places

	Using a styrofoam wig head is a great aid in a
variety of construction methods,  standing in as thy
own head.  Among first consideration is prevnting
baraclava from adhering to styrofoam head. 
	____

	2 - Some experienced 'How to' resorces:
	^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
	Assorted methods of head construction and mold
casting
http://www.fursuit.info/
	____

	Fox head mold using firberglass
http://www.transwarp.com/~loriana/fursuits.html
	____

	BUILD DIRECTLY onto baracava with Canvas mesh (bottom
of page)?
http://www.nicodemus.org/fursuit/framehead.php
	____

	Head carved from block of rigid foam:
http://www.nicodemus.org/fursuit/foamhead.php

	 |\,/|
	< * * > 
	  \_/
	   - 'Monkaya'
	friendly neighborhood werewolf.

From RTRabbitNY at aol.com  Mon Dec  4 20:01:32 2006

Yes indeed, they have been holding a DooDah Parade in Ocean City NJ  since 
1986 and the "Rapid T. Rabbit and Friends" fursuit brigade has been   a part of 
it since 1995.  It's usually on the Saturday after Tax Day (i.e.  after April 
15) unless delayed due to the occurrence of Palm Sunday or  Easter.  All are 
welcome to join us!
 
Rapid T. Rabbit

Look for Great Value Fresh Linen Antibacterial Spray Disinfectant
 
Rapid T. Rabbit

From snglspdcat at gmail.com  Tue Dec  5 10:36:01 2006
From: snglspdcat at gmail.com (single speed cheeta)
Date: Tue, 5 Dec 2006 10:36:01 -0500
Subject: FL: Endbac II
In-Reply-To: <77b0f0110612050345q292c168ai5b60dca614369a31@mail.gmail.com>
References: <c8c.3e7bc5a.32a6b358@aol.com>
	<77b0f0110612050345q292c168ai5b60dca614369a31@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <c23fb4800612050736v44686f4fn295ee575689caf2d@mail.gmail.com>

I've been using the Walmart brand for several years on a bunch of 'suits. I
think it works pretty well. At less then two bucks a can, it's a bargan.
It's easier to get then Enbac as well. Enbac needs to be ordered (usually by
the case) from a medical supply. No, it doesn't smell very good. But then
neither does Enbac, imo. But they both smell better then a dirty, damp
'suit. K-Mart has no equivalent product to my knowledge.

Single Speedy

From rsg0910 at iglou.com  Tue Dec  5 18:02:54 2006
From: rsg0910 at iglou.com (Robert Goodwin)
Date: Tue, 5 Dec 2006 18:02:54 -0500 (EST)
Subject: FL: Endbac II
In-Reply-To: <no.id> from "lex f" at Dec 05, 2006 05:32:05 PM
Message-ID: <E1GrjJO-0002Fs-NK@shell1.iglou.com>

> Try looking for it at wallmart they might have it.

I often see the Great Value Fresh Linen antibacterial spray disinfectant 
at Walmart as Rapid said. I've got a can with me as well as a couple cans 
of Endbac II. I don't know if they have the same thing at Kmart or Target. 
Maybe someone here on the list could check?

Rapid, you also said something about a similar product at NYC's Duane 
Reade drugstores? What was it again?

If you don't want to buy the stuff by the case of 12 cans, you might find 
it at some janitorial supply shops. I wouldn't suggest getting it via 
mailorder as many places will tack on hazardous materials fees besides the 
usual shipping charges.

However, if you're able to get the gallon liquid sizes, you're pretty much 
set for a long while. Just pour the stuff into trigger sprayers and go 
from there. You may have to dilute the stuff a bit. I might be a bit wrong 
on that.

-boogi-

(looking a bit frazzled what with finals approaching)

The active ingredients are n-Alkyl dimethyl benzyl ammonium chlorides and n-alkyl ethylbenzyl ammonium chlorides with Ethyl Alchohol.

If you can find something at K-Mart with that mix it's similar to Endbac II (though the Duane Reade version has a slightly lower ratio of the N-Alkyl ingredients than real Endbac 2)

-Damian

From galen at velocity.net  Tue Dec  5 23:13:31 2006
From: galen at velocity.net (FoxWolfie Galen)

Message-ID: <15gcn219h4sbvt6igj6rba6t3h2q4j6v7l@4ax.com>

On Tue, 5 Dec 2006 03:45:36 -0800, "Kalagei The Fox" <kalagei at gmail.com>
wrote:

> The stuff from walmart is really bad smelling by itself.

Walmart actually sells their Great Value antibacterial spray in two
different scents. One is summer scent, which doesn't smell much like
Endbac. The other is fresh linen scent, which smells very similar to
Endbac. The ingredients in all of them are basically the same, though the
exact percentages differ a little. The big difference is that Endbac is
hard to find and $5 to $8 a can. The Walmart stuff is easy to find and only
$1.75 a can.
-- 
FoxWolfie

On Sat, 9 Dec 2006, Karknak wrote:
>A serious 'Do it yourself' digitgrade hoof project idea:
>http://www.transform.to/~mwbard/stuff/equinecostumeconstruction-hooves.htm.

The principles are sound, and are the same which have been arrived at by
others either independently or through comparative research, development 
and innovation, including (but not limited to):

http://www.lordsofthehoof.com/index_files/construction.html
http://www.flickr.com/photos/curiousgeo/sets/1307198
http://www.tatopoulos.net/creature_effects/Underworld/Photo/Underworld16.jpg
see also the film "Wendigo" by Larry Fessenden

Keep up the good work, and good luck.

-Cordite

---
www.lordsofthehoof.com
---

From yippeecoyote at yahoo.com  Wed Dec 13 02:06:41 2006
From: yippeecoyote at yahoo.com (Jimmy Chin)
Date: Tue, 12 Dec 2006 23:06:41 -0800 (PST)
Subject: FL: FURther CONfusion '007 Furry Night Live
Message-ID: <513010.81776.qm@web30512.mail.mud.yahoo.com>

Get ready your spy gear, decoder rings and undercover disguises, Agents! It's
less than six weeks away from FURther CONfusion 2007. 

Furry Night Live is back again on Sunday night at FC'007 as the number one
place to see furry variety acts performed live. Break out the shoe phone and
deploy those dashing agents, femmes fatales, and thuggish hench-bears. Your
mission, should you choose to accept it: Assemble your secret forces to
put together an act or skit fitting the spy theme "Fur Your Eyes Only."
Once again we will feature cash prizes for the audience choice of favorite
acts.

Are you a Rogue Agent with no act or skit?  Not an Impossible Mission! Our
crack team of operatives will have scripts, acts, and skits for you to
participate in. For more information contact Furry Night Live Lead, Yippee
Coyote, at fnl at furtherconfusion.org. To subscribe to the official Furry Night
Live discussion E-mail list go to:
http://www.furtherconfusion.org/fc2007/fnl_signup.php

Be sure to sign up before the end of 2006 as there will be important
information distributed through the list prior to the convention. Time is
running out!

Schedule of events:
Friday January 19 2007
Orientation: 10:30 am

Sunday January 21 2007
First Rehearsal: 9:00 am - 12:00 pm
Final Rehearsal: 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm
Showtime: 8:00 PM

This email will self-destruct in thirty seconds...

Jimmy Chin / Yippee Coyote
FC'007 FNL Lead Operative

From santafox at comcast.net  Wed Dec 13 12:23:47 2006
From: santafox at comcast.net (Santa Fox)
Date: Wed, 13 Dec 2006 17:23:47 +0000
Subject: FL: Southern Tails: FWA December Newsletter
Message-ID: <121320061723.4981.45803722000F11FF0000137522064246139801000E9B020E9C@comcast.net>

SOUTHERN TAILS
The official newsletter of Furry Weekend Atlanta
February 16-18, 2007
Sheraton Gateway Hotel
Atlanta, GA, USA
http://www.furryweekend.com

IN THIS ISSUE

1. New (Old) Editor
2. What can you do with five dollars?
3. Dealers Den Space still available!
4. Hotel is filling up!
5. Programming Spotlight: Masquerade!
6. Programming Spotlight: First Convention Panel!
7. Volunteers Needed
8. Happy Holidaze From FWA!

# NEW (OLD) EDITOR

I want to thank Spiral Gryphon for covering for me while I took care of some things. I'm happy to announce that Kiran Lightpaw is now back at the helm of Southern Tails and will be bringing you all the fantastic news from the Dogwood City once gain.

# WHAT CAN YOU DO WITH FIVE DOLLARS?

Pre-registering for Furry Weekend Atlanta will save you five dollars off our Attending and Sponsoring levels, and 20 dollars off our God-Level registration as compared to the cost at the door. So ... what can you do with five dollars? You can ... buy a meal at any of the restaurants within a short distance of the hotel or stay right within the Sheraton for a good meal. You can spend it at some of the dealers in the dealers den or artists in the artists alley and buy a badge commission! There's literally hundreds of things you can do with an extra five dollars in your pocket, but you won't have that extra cash if you don't pre-register! (http://www.furryweekend.com/registration)

# DEALERS DEN SPACE STILL AVAILABLE

Got something you want to sell? Well, we have space for you to sell it! Registration for the dealer's room for this year's FWA is open. Prices start at $70 for one table and one membership. Included in this price is free power and internet (on a first come, first served basis) and free lunches Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Full details, including how to register, can be found at our website (http://www.furryweekend.com/dealers). If you have any questions, feel free to email us at
dealersden at furryweekend.com

# HOTEL IS FILLING UP!

We've already filled our first block of rooms and have expanded to a second block! The Sheraton is a much nicer hotel than our previous home at the Holiday Inn and features, among other things, all interior rooms! That's right - no more freezing in February walking down to the con! In addition, a select number of Furry Weekend Atlanta hotel patrons may find a special gift for booking rooms early! Furry Weekend Altanta has negotiated a special Furry Weekend Atlanta rate for the convention of $89.00 per night for single, double, triple and quad occupancy. However, to take advantage of this rate, you must contact Sheraton Reservations at 1-800-325-3535 and request the "Furry Weekend Atlanta" room block and rate OR book online through our website (http://www.furryweekend.com/hotel).

# PROGRAMMING SPOTLIGHT: MASQUERADE

The Fursuit Masquerade is a two part event where fursuits and fursuiters will be judged on both technical and performance criteria, with awards for the top winners in each category. Best of all, the performance session on Sunday afternoon will be open for everyone to come and watch, so participants will get to show off their talents for an excited audience of their fellow furs. Competition will occur in two categories, Novice and Master, and the Masquerade Performance will have an Exhibition (i.e. unjudged) session for anyone who wants to do a more traditional variety show style act. Full details, including rules and guidelines will be posted to the Furry Weekend Atlanta website at a later date: (http://www.furryweekend.com/fs_activities)

# PROGRAMMING SPOTLIGHT: FIRST CONVENTION PANEL

Is this your first convention, or your hundredth? Either way, this Furry Weekend Atlanta original panel, first introduced in 2005 and each year a success, will be your introduction to convention culture. From complex subjects like etiquette to more mundane things like how to prevent the con funk and deal with PCD, our First Con panel is sure to help neophyte and seasoned veteran alike.

# VOLUNTEERS WANTED

Interested in lending a paw at Furry Weekend Atlanta? Let our volunteering director know! Contact him at volunteers at furryweekend.com.

# HAPPY HOLIDAZE FROM FURRY WEEKEND ATLANTA!

Furry Weekend Atlanta would like to wish all of our family (that's y'all!) the best of holiday wishes during this festive season. If you're traveling, travel safely. If you're shopping, look out for that guy about to deck you over a Nintendo Wii, and if you're just hanging out, have fun and be safe, because we want to see ALL of you in February in Atlanta!

Furry Weekend Atlanta
The Deep South's Anthropomorphics Exposition
February 16-18, 2007
Sheraton Gateway Hotel
Atlanta, GA, USA
http://www.furryweekend.com
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
P.S. Be sure to check out all of the fursuiting fun on our much expanded fursuiting track: 

http://www.furryweekend.com/fursuiting/

Cheers,
Santa Fox
FWA Fursuit and Pawpet Track Director

--
Santa Fox's Den - http://santafox.home.comcast.net/

From marcwolf at anubis-systems.com  Thu Dec 14 02:20:06 2006
From: marcwolf at anubis-systems.com (David Boccabella)
Date: Thu, 14 Dec 2006 17:20:06 +1000
Subject: FL: Tail Wag Video
In-Reply-To: <437089.35412.qm@web55901.mail.re3.yahoo.com>
Message-ID: <OMEIJPJAFKIANLCOEJOIGEHCEBAA.marcwolf@anubis-systems.com>


Hi folks

I have been busy with a couple of projects and have decided to make a couple
of short instructional video's on them.

The fist is my animatronic tail wagging mechanism.  Many many thanks to
Wolftail for providing the inspiration.

One of the problems that I have when I am in my suit is that I get a LOT of
abuse from kids. This is usually tugging on the tail etc. So any work that I
do needs to beable to cope with this.

Here is a short 2min 2Mb WMV movie of the tails mechanism instructions.

http://marcwolf.org/tailwag.wmv

Oh - yes - you get to see the wolf out of his costume too.

Enjoy - please any feedback would be great as I plan to do a few more of
these. I have recently discovered PicAXE's - a really neat little chip(s)
that are perfect for the amature hobbiest and I will basing most of my work
around these.

To come.

Controller glove so I can send instructions to the master animation
controller.

Master animation controller with programming details on how to get it to
work.

Possibly ears, nose, jaw, and muzzle flaps work too.

I truly hopes tha this can help folks realise their dreams of making their
costumes more than what they currently are

Take Care

Marcwolf

--

cost.

interested.

if there are like 300 interested, thats 300 sets of
300 cards.

please INDIVIDUALLY EMAIL ME if interested.
Otherwise we will probably flood the list. Hehehee

character name, race/animal type, age?, height?

somewhere
so they will look really sharp!

let me know asap.

From marcwolf at anubis-systems.com  Thu Dec 14 17:16:23 2006
From: marcwolf at anubis-systems.com (David Boccabella)
Date: Fri, 15 Dec 2006 08:16:23 +1000
Subject: FL: Tail Wag Video
In-Reply-To: <d23d76ca0612140900k21879706ra55417889cc231f7@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <OMEIJPJAFKIANLCOEJOIAEHMEBAA.marcwolf@anubis-systems.com>

Hi Donkey

There should be no trouble adapting this for an equine tail.

Basically you shorten the tail and put a hinge section at the top so that
the remaining tail can move more freely.
The rest of the tail can be  something looser like heavy cord so it can add
to the flick.

Servo's can move VERY fast if needed. You are looking at 0.3 seconds to move
a quarter turn.

The randomness is just a function of the controller and that can be
programmed into one easily. The PicAXE has a random function which will
generate a random number. One can then use that to send a new position to
the tail and you get a  'Flick' or 'Twitch' depending on the difference
between the last servo position and the new one.

Servo's are very interesting little mechanisms and I plan to do a small
video talk on them and using them.

Hope this helps..

Take Care

Marcwolf



   -----Original Message-----

From solion at comcast.net  Fri Dec 15 14:33:40 2006
From: solion at comcast.net (Lionel Vogt)
Date: Fri, 15 Dec 2006 14:33:40 -0500
Subject: FL: Video system for new mask
References: <BAY103-F20197BE90D7C11AF87C6EABAD40@phx.gbl>
Message-ID: <004c01c7207f$eec4f890$aa00a8c0@lioni35z8u5vou>

I am making a full sized lion mask for Don, in this system we have 2 driver 
boards on one pair of I -Theater glasses
and 2 video cameras for a stereo vision system. here is a link. Depending on 
camera type highly sensitive IR cameras will give you the
ability to see in night vision mode with IR leds for illumination

here is a link
http://www.lionofthesun.com/gallery/view_album.php?set_albumName=album17

Lionel



From marcwolf at anubis-systems.com  Fri Dec 15 17:14:56 2006
From: marcwolf at anubis-systems.com (David Boccabella)
Date: Sat, 16 Dec 2006 08:14:56 +1000
Subject: FL: Video system for new mask
In-Reply-To: <004c01c7207f$eec4f890$aa00a8c0@lioni35z8u5vou>
Message-ID: <OMEIJPJAFKIANLCOEJOIEEJAEBAA.marcwolf@anubis-systems.com>

Brilliant.. Simply Brilliant.

A while ago I saw a similar idea (back in mid 90's)  and this was a heads up
display for  people working on airforece equipment. It would  give them an
overlay schematic on whatever they were working on.

But this certainly has come a LONG way from that.

A couple of questions.

You needed 2 driver boards. Is this because you could not tap into the video
feed for each eyepiece or was the information to each eyepiece already
processed.

If one could put up with the lost of depth perception then you could just
use one driver board.

Hopefully the price will come down for the units as I can see a lot of
possibiliites re costuming. One would nolonger be limited to having to look
out of the suit. And the little camera's are small enough to be put
anywhere - like in a nose.

Take care Lionel and many many thanks for sharing.

Marcwolf

Me Me Me Me! Of course, you're only as old as your fursuit looks :) I 
have been on the furry internet thingy since Sept. 96 and celebrated 10 
years in furry net world then. Kissed my old 100 mhz computer and 
everything.  Funny though, I still have not replaced my fursuit. Haven't 
built another one and haven't bought one, had the desire but NOPE. My 
dog is my dog. SO, piccies taken as early as CFE96 look just like ones 
taken at MFF2006(with different hatware, oh, I didn't have a tail at CFE. )

Remember when there was maybe 20-30 fursuits at a con? Now there's furs 
that have 20-30 fursuits :)

ARF! -Ric

It's funny...

I still have my second suit, which remains my only
suit.

But, since I've lost a ton of weight, (almost 65lbs in
6mos) he's turning into more of a Sharpei, so, it's
soon going to be time to see about replacing him... 
But, I've been informed by my wife that I'm not
allowed to sell the suit, as, I used it to propose to
her in. :) 

S.

From francisco-sender-6f5fe9 at vulpes.net  Thu Dec 21 17:00:29 2006
From: francisco-sender-6f5fe9 at vulpes.net (Francisco Azinsan)
Date: Thu, 21 Dec 2006 16:00:29 -0600
Subject: FL: FC2007: Fur Your Eyes Only - December Mission Briefing
Message-ID: <20061221220029.GA21370@corvus.critter.net>


December Mission Briefing:

Just a few quick notes before everyone heads off for the holidays. Safe
travel and happy holidays to all our agents, villains and faithful henchmen.
We'll have one final mission briefing for you immediately after the Jan 6
meeting.

In this briefing:
1. Pre-Registration Cutoff Date Reminder
2. Hotel Reservation Cutoff Date Reminder
3. Fursuit Badge Procedure
4. Artshow Sold out
5. Preliminary Schedule Published
6. Furly Edition Zero
7. Fursuit Airbrush Techniques panel
8. Next Public Meeting



1. Pre-Registration Cutoff Date Reminder

Just a reminder that with the holidays fast approaching, the deadline for
preregistration cutoff is December 30. Standing in lines makes any agent an
open target ya know. Avoid that fate and save $5 at the same time!

<http://www.furtherconfusion.org/fc2007/onlinereg.php>

2. Hotel Reservation Cutoff Date Reminder

December 30 is also the cutoff for hotel reservations. Not that there are
likely to be any left at the convention rate by then...but you never know,
there may be some agents who just can't make it. Pesky henchman and all that
sort of thing.


3. Fursuit Badge Procedure

If you have a fursuit, are pre-registered, and need a fursuit badge, here's
what to do. Before January 1, 2007, send a picture of your fursuit to
fursuit-badges at furtherconfusion.org and include the following information in
the email:

- Your real name
- The fursuit name
- Your registration confirmation number

The file can be any standard picture format (JPEG, PNG, TIFF, etc.) at 300
DPI with a usable area of 450 by 600 pixels.

The first fursuit badge is free (though a donation to the convention would
be appreciated), while subsequent badges are $5 each.

Photographs for fursuit badges will also be taken at the convention.
Please see the times that will be posted at the Registration Desk for the
hours this will be offered.


4. Artshow Sold out

The Artshow for FC2007 is sold out. We expect that applications currently in
the mail will fill in the remaining panels. While we're excited that our
show has filled in record time, we're also
sad that some artists will miss out. We'll do our best to have as many of
you in the show as possible.

If you'd like to be put on a waiting list, please send in your application
as usual and we'll inform you if you have guaranteed space, or if you're on
the waiting list. We won't bank any cheques until we can guarantee you
space. It is usual that some artists cancel, or reduce their panel numbers
leading up to the con, so don't give up hope just yet. Also, it's common
that unused panels become available at show, so even if we can't guarantee
you panels, you may want to plan to bring along a half or full panel's worth
of artwork "just in case". Tell us if you're doing this, so we can keep you
informed, and prepare our databases before the show. 


5. Preliminary Schedule Published

A preliminary version of the schedule for Further Confusion 2007 is now
online at our WWW site, available at:

<http://www.furtherconfusion.org/fc2007/schedulebyday.php>

This schedule is connected directly into our scheduling system, so is
subject to change as we work on putting the year's convention together. But
things are getting pretty well locked down. So, take a peek, see what we
have to offer now, and check back as we give you even more reason to make it
out to San Jose, in January.


6. Furly Edition Zero

The Furly Edition is your at con newsletter for all the latest news and
mission briefings. This includes Public party announcements, schedule
changes, and anything else that is general information at con. These
announcements should be text only and should be submitted to us by Jan 7,
2006 for Furly Edition Zero. That issue will be available at Registration.
The at con editions will have submission boxes placed at ConOps and our Info
Desk but if you have anything early, please send it to
newsletter at furtherconfusion.org no later than January 7.


7. Fursuit Airbrush Techniques panel

Lance Ikegawa and Eric Yee will be again be demonstrating their skill with
the airbrush Sunday at 1PM, and will be looking for a few volunteers to
help with the demonstration.  If you have any fursuit heads you'd like to
see a bit of touching up done on, make sure to bring them to the panel,
which will be held just outside of the convention entrance.  Have an idea
of what you'd like to see, and they will see what they can do to make it a
reality.


8. Next Public Meeting

Our next staff meeting will be January  starting at noon in the San
Jose Doubletree. Parking is free - just tell the parking attendant that
you're with Further Confusion when you arrive, and then get a sticker for
your parking slip in the meeting.


The world outside these walls is an illusion; it's not really there for
us. We're ghosts. 
-- 
Further Confusion
info at furtherconfusion.org
http://www.furtherconfusion.org/

Hello.
     I am planning to eventually have a meet for fursuiters in Colorado, Yes 
I am aware of the existence of the web site Meetups.com but I hate putting 
more work into something that doesn't require it.
Anyway, I would like to have any fursuiter in Colorado or any surrounding 
state wanting to participate in the event E-mail this address so I can better 
figure out when and where would be the best time to hold his based on the 
schedules of the participants. Then hopefully the scattered bunch of fursuiters can 
be brought together.
Any tagalongs are welcome


Omen Vixen

common after all.

message.  This is much faster than posting a message to the list
demanding to be unsubscribed.
